snippet: Xu Zhiyong’s fight made him one of China’s best-known human rights advocates, and it has now landed him in prison.
abstract: Op-Ed article by filmmaker Hua Ze describes plight of Chinese human-rights activist lawyer  Xu Zhiyong, who has been falsely charged of assembling a crowd to create disorder after being under house arrest for 90 days; notes Xu has been tireless in his advocacy, even in face of beatings and imprisonment.
lead_paragraph: Xu Zhiyong’s fight made him one of China’s best-known human rights advocates, and it has now landed him in prison.
